sub_topic: Identifying the isomorphism between two graphs.
message_1:
Consider the following two graphs G1 and G2:

G1:

```
A---B
|   |
C---D
```

G2:

```
1---2
|   |
3---4
```

Find out whether the graphs G1 and G2 are isomorphic or not. If they are isomorphic, provide an isomorphism between the two graphs. If they are not isomorphic, explain why.
message_2:
The graphs G1 and G2 are isomorphic. This means that there is a one-to-one correspondence between their vertices and edges, preserving adjacency.

Here is an isomorphism between the two graphs:

A -> 1
B -> 2
C -> 3
D -> 4

Under this correspondence, the edges of G1 and G2 match up as follows:

A-B -> 1-2
A-C -> 1-3
B-D -> 2-4
C-D -> 3-4

Since there is a one-to-one correspondence between the vertices and edges of G1 and G2 that preserves adjacency, the two graphs are isomorphic.
